text: acrocephaly 50% Narrow mouth 50% Short stature 50% Abnormality of thumb phalanx 7.5% Atria septal defect 7.5% Full cheeks 7.5% Long philtrum 7.5% Muscular hypotonia 7.5% Pectus carinatum 7.5% Preaxial foot polydactyly 7.5% Seizures 7.5% Thickened helices 7.5% Ventriculomegaly 7.5% Wide nasal bridge 7.5% The Human Phenotype Ontology (HPO) has collected information on how often a sign or symptom occurs in a condition. Much of this information comes from Orphanet, a European rare disease database.
